definition: to strive for mastery (idiom); aiming for the best result/to have high ambitions
power/force/strength/ability/strenuously
surname Li
to strive for/to vie for/to argue or debate/deficient or lacking (dialect)/how or what (literary)
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)
see 上聲|上声[shang3 sheng1]
surname You
to swim/variant of 遊|游[you2]

sentences.english: And Coca-Cola managed to make itself one of the most widely distributed products of wartime.
sentences.chinese: 可口可樂更力爭上游，成爲戰時最暢銷產品之一。

sentences.english: Zhu said, as he headed for an electronics factory, where he would inquire about profitability.
sentences.chinese: 朱先生曾經領導過一家電子廠，在利益率上力爭上游。

sentences.english: To strive to be a pace-setter.
sentences.chinese: 一個好學生要有力爭上游的決心。

sentences.english: We must improve in every area.
sentences.chinese: 我們應在各個領域力爭上游。

sentences.english: I would then like to work up to a senior position, such as being a project team leader.
sentences.chinese: 之後我想要力爭上游得到像專案經理這樣的主管職位。

sentences.english: Each student strives for the best in this class.
sentences.chinese: 這個班級每個同學都力爭上游。

sentences.english: New avenues of achievement require commitment to growth.
sentences.chinese: 決心力爭上游纔會有新的成就。

sentences.english: Some young men have no idea to be the top one in anything;
sentences.chinese: 一些年輕人從不力爭上游，他們是可悲的。

sentences.english: Race to the Top had good goals, but poor implementation.
sentences.chinese: “力爭上游”計劃的目標很好，但是實施很糟。

definition: to assume personal responsibility (idiom); to take charge of a section
lit. to cross five passes and slay six generals (idiom)/fig. to surmount all difficulties (on the way to success)
pinyin: guo4 wu3 guan1 zhan3 liu4 jiang4

definition: (abbr. for 嘗試錯誤|尝试错误) trial and error/failure
to be at the highest level of enlightenment (Buddhist expression)
to charge and break through enemy lines
one step, one footprint (idiom); steady progress/reliable
pinyin: yi1 bu4 yi1 ge4 jiao3 yin4

definition: sunrise industry
to be drowned (figurative and literal)
enormously proud of one's success (idiom); smug/complacent
highest common factor HCF/greatest common divisor GCD
civil society
to follow through/to carry through to the end
It takes ten years to nurture a tree, but a hundred years to train a man (idiom)/fig. a good education program takes a long time to develop/cf. 十年樹木，百年樹人|十年树木，百年树人
courage/bravery
to prevail upon/to coax
economist
